I can do all things through Christ who strengthens me. – Philippians 4:13
The Lord is my shepherd; I shall not want. – Psalm 23:1
Be strong and courageous. – Joshua 1:9
Love your neighbor as yourself. – Matthew 22:39
Rejoice in the Lord always. – Philippians 4:4
Commit your work to the Lord, and your plans will succeed. – Proverbs 16:3
Blessed are the pure in heart, for they shall see God. – Matthew 5:8
Seek first the kingdom of God. – Matthew 6:33
Do not fear, for I am with you. – Isaiah 41:10
The joy of the Lord is your strength. – Nehemiah 8:10
Cast all your anxiety on Him, because He cares for you. – 1 Peter 5:7
Let all that you do be done in love. – 1 Corinthians 16:14
For where your treasure is, there your heart will be also. – Matthew 6:21
I am the way, the truth, and the life. – John 14:6
Ask, and it will be given to you. – Matthew 7:7
The Lord is near to all who call on Him. – Psalm 145:18
Even though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil. – Psalm 23:4
Let your light shine before others. – Matthew 5:16
Be still, and know that I am God. – Psalm 46:10
Delight yourself in the Lord, and He will give you the desires of your heart. – Psalm 37:4
God is our refuge and strength, a very present help in trouble. – Psalm 46:1

The Lord bless you and keep you. – Numbers 6:24
Pray without ceasing. – 1 Thessalonians 5:17
Do not be conformed to this world, but be transformed by the renewal of your mind. – Romans 12:2
Bear one another's burdens, and so fulfill the law of Christ. – Galatians 6:2
God is love. – 1 John 4:8
For I know the plans I have for you, declares the Lord, plans to prosper you and not to harm you. – Jeremiah 29:11
Blessed are the meek, for they shall inherit the earth. – Matthew 5:5
Whoever exalts himself will be humbled, and whoever humbles himself will be exalted. – Matthew 23:12
A soft answer turns away wrath. – Proverbs 15:1
The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom. – Proverbs 9:10
He heals the brokenhearted and binds up their wounds. – Psalm 147:3
Be kind to one another, tenderhearted, forgiving one another. – Ephesians 4:32
Let no corrupting talk come out of your mouths. – Ephesians 4:29
Whatever you do, work heartily, as for the Lord and not for men. – Colossians 3:23
Do not be anxious about anything, but in everything by prayer and supplication with thanksgiving let your requests be made known to God. – Philippians 4:6
And we know that in all things God works for the good of those who love him. – Romans 8:28
Cast your burden on the Lord, and he will sustain you. – Psalm 55:22
Train up a child in the way he should go. – Proverbs 22:6
For God gave us a spirit not of fear but of power and love and self-control. – 2 Timothy 1:7

The steadfast love of the Lord never ceases; his mercies never come to an end. – Lamentations 3:22
For where two or three are gathered in my name, there am I among them. – Matthew 18:20
Do not let your hearts be troubled. – John 14:1
Let everything that has breath praise the Lord. – Psalm 150:6
Taste and see that the Lord is good. – Psalm 34:8
Faith is the assurance of things hoped for, the conviction of things not seen. – Hebrews 11:1
Blessed is the one who perseveres under trial. – James 1:12
Whoever believes in the Son has eternal life. – John 3:36
Love your enemies and pray for those who persecute you. – Matthew 5:44
Therefore encourage one another and build one another up. – 1 Thessalonians 5:11
Let us not grow weary of doing good. – Galatians 6:9
He will cover you with his pinions, and under his wings you will find refuge. – Psalm 91:4
For by grace you have been saved through faith. – Ephesians 2:8
Seek the Lord while he may be found. – Isaiah 55:6
Do not repay evil for evil. – Romans 12:17
Blessed are those who mourn, for they shall be comforted. – Matthew 5:4
Delight in the law of the Lord, and meditate on it day and night. – Psalm 1:2
The righteous cry out, and the Lord hears them. – Psalm 34:17
He who dwells in the shelter of the Most High will abide in the shadow of the Almighty. – Psalm 91:1
For I am with you always, even to the end of the age. – Matthew 28:20
My lips will pour forth praise. – Psalm 71:8
God is our refuge and strength, an ever-present help in trouble. – Psalm 46:1
I will instruct you and teach you in the way you should go. – Psalm 32:8
You shall love the Lord your God with all your heart. – Deuteronomy 6:5
A friend loves at all times. – Proverbs 17:17
The name of the Lord is a strong tower; the righteous run into it and are safe. – Proverbs 18:10
Even a child is known by his deeds. – Proverbs 20:11
Blessed is the one who finds wisdom. – Proverbs 3:13
The Lord your God is in your midst, a mighty one who will save. – Zephaniah 3:17
Do not grieve the Holy Spirit. – Ephesians 4:30

The Lord is righteous in all his ways. – Psalm 145:17

Behold, I am making all things new. – Revelation 21:5
Blessed are the merciful, for they shall obtain mercy. – Matthew 5:7
He who has ears, let him hear. – Matthew 11:15
Let everything that has breath praise the Lord. – Psalm 150:6
The Lord is my light and my salvation. – Psalm 27:1
For nothing will be impossible with God. – Luke 1:37

Do not be afraid, little flock, for your Father has been pleased to give you the kingdom. – Luke 12:32
The Lord is gracious and merciful. – Psalm 145:8
He has made everything beautiful in its time. – Ecclesiastes 3:11
God is faithful, who will not let you be tempted beyond your ability. – 1 Corinthians 10:13
The Lord lifts up those who are bowed down. – Psalm 146:8
The steadfast love of the Lord never ceases. – Lamentations 3:22
I will instruct you and teach you. – Psalm 32:8
Even to your old age I am He. – Isaiah 46:4
Let your hope make you glad. – Romans 12:12
Do not be overcome by evil, but overcome evil with good. – Romans 12:21
You shall not steal. – Exodus 20:15
The Lord will fight for you, and you have only to be silent. – Exodus 14:14
Be merciful, even as your Father is merciful. – Luke 6:36
Honor your father and mother. – Exodus 20:12

Faith, hope, and love abide. – 1 Corinthians 13:13
Do not lie to one another. – Colossians 3:9
Be thankful in all circumstances. – 1 Thessalonians 5:18
Let no corrupting talk come out of your mouths. – Ephesians 4:29
Be kind to one another, tenderhearted. – Ephesians 4:32
Walk in love, as Christ loved us. – Ephesians 5:2
For God did not give us a spirit of fear. – 2 Timothy 1:7
Remember the Sabbath day, to keep it holy. – Exodus 20:8
And the Word became flesh and dwelt among us. – John 1:14
Blessed is the one who does not walk in the counsel of the wicked. – Psalm 1:1

Taste and see that the Lord is good. – Psalm 34:8
